item.title: Amazon Music’s 2025 Delivered is now here to compete with Spotify Wrapped
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Amazon Music's 2025 Delivered introduced new badges for listeners to show off. For example, the “Headliner” badge recognizes fans who fall in the top percentage of an artist’s listeners.

item.title: India plans to verify and record every smartphone in circulation
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The Indian government has ordered smartphone makers to preinstall its Sanchar Saathi app on all devices, a move that is raising fresh privacy concerns.

item.title: Paris-based AI voice startup Gradium nabs $70M seed
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Gradium, a startup spawned out of French AI lab Kyutai (backed by French telecom billionaire Xavier Niel), launched out of stealth on Tuesday.

item.title: What does it mean when Uncle Sam is one of your biggest shareholders? Chip startup xLight is about to find out
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: You can imagine how this is all going over in Silicon Valley, where the libertarian ethos runs deep.

item.title: Apple just named a new AI chief with Google and Microsoft expertise, as John Giannandrea steps down
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: His replacement is Amar Subramanya, a highly regarded Microsoft executive who spent 16 years at Google, most recently leading engineering for the Gemini Assistant. It's a savvy hire, given that Subramanya knows the competition intimately.

item.title: One of Google’s biggest AI advantages is what it already knows about you
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The promise is AI that's uniquely helpful because it knows you. But the risk is AI that feels more like surveillance than service.

item.title: Zillow drops climate risk scores after agents complained of lost sales
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The move is a loss for homebuyers, who through Zillow had ready access to a property's climate risk scores from First Street.

item.title: Shopify resolves outage disrupting merchants on Cyber Monday
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Shopify was down for many merchants this morning, preventing them from processing transactions. It appears to be fixed now.

item.title: Nvidia announces new open AI models and tools for autonomous driving research
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Nvidia continues its push into physical AI with the release of a new reasoning world model and other tools for physical AI.

item.title: AWS re:Invent 2025: How to watch and follow along live
item.dc:creator: Morgan Little
item.description: Amazon Web Services’ big annual event, re:Invent 2025, is getting into full swing in Las Vegas this week, and you can follow the keynotes live right here.

item.title: MKBHD’s wallpaper app Panels is shutting down
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: From the time Brownlee launched Panels in September 2024, the app struggled to find an audience of its own. "We knew it was niche … and ultimately, we weren't able to turn it into the vision I had," Marques Brownlee said.

item.title: Construction workers are cashing in on the AI boom
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: "I pinch myself going to work every day," one 51-year-old says of his new supervisor role overseeing 200 workers at a data center site.

item.title: Data center energy demand forecasted to soar nearly 300% through 2035
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: New planned data centers promise to consume even more energy than expected. Meanwhile, a grid monitor is blaming such growth for high electricity prices.

item.title: European cops shut down crypto mixing website that helped launder 1.3B euros
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Europol announced the seizure of Cryptomixer’s official website, as well as 25 million euros and 12 terabytes of data from the mixer's service.

item.title: Festivitas lets you decorate your Apple devices with holiday lights and snow
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: This year, the whimsical holiday app comes to iPhone and adds a snow effect for Mac users.

item.title: OpenAI’s investment into Thrive Holdings is its latest circular deal
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Analysts will be watching to see if Thrive-owned firms actually succeed in building long-term profitable businesses using OpenAI’s tech, or if the result is really just pumped up valuations based on speculative market potential.

item.title: Deezer rolls out ‘My Deezer Year 2025,’ its Spotify Wrapped clone
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Deezer launched its version of Spotify Wrapped to give listeners an overview of their top tracks and artists.

item.title: Nvidia’s $2B Synopsys bet tightens its grip on the chip-design stack
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The $2 billion investment in Synopsys, which makes software and components for designing semiconductor chips, deepens their existing partnership at a time when analysts scrutinize circular AI-industry deals and warn of a potential bubble.

item.title: Amazon’s AI chatbot Rufus drove sales on Black Friday
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: On Black Friday, Amazon sessions that resulted in a sale were up 100% in the U.S. when the AI chatbot Rufus was used. They only increased by 20% when Rufus wasn't used.

item.title: How AI PR startup Clipbook won Mark Cuban’s investment from a cold email
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Adam Joseph was shocked when Mark Cuban replied to his email with an inquisition full of questions.
